poem:
**On Seeing a Royal Arrival in the News**

Baby Athena, graced by borrowed light,  
a photograph locks the petals of morning,  
blanketed in privacy—small sanctuary.  
Outside, faces press against the buzzing glass,  
while she dreams, a quiet satellite  
in the unremarkable sea of night.  
A laugh curls through the pages  
like a forgotten breeze.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Princess Beatrice has chosen to protect her new baby’s privacy online – good for her | Rhiannon Lucy Cosslett Maybe I shouldn’t admit this, but when I saw the photo of Princess Beatrice’s new baby, I laughed. Hear me out, though, before you decide I’m a horrible person: I expect baby Athena – lovely name – is perfectly lovely, and having arrived early, as my son did, will have quite a lot of feeding and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
